column3:
Should both lines 33 and 34 refer to `getblockheader` instead? e.g. combine the two into:

* Update `src/chainparams.cpp` nMinimumChainWork, defaultAssumeValid, and the block height comment with information from the `getblockheader` RPC.

Oh, true, interesting that clicking the link still jumps down to the intended section ðŸ‘€ \nobviously this wouldn't work as soon as the section headline text changes -- I guess using a named anchor would be the better way, apparently that's possible with HTML in markdown: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5319754/cross-reference-named-anchor-in-markdown/7335259#7335259 (untested)

Good idea! Particularly I think `getblockchaininfo` should not be used here, as it only shows the chainwork for the _last_ block, i.e. it is not useful for potential reviewers of the updated parameters. Maybe refer to `getblockheader` RPC but also add a note to `getblockhash` in parantheses, as this is useful to convert block height to block hash? (As pointed out in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitc
Oops, I meant to write getblockheader instead of getblockhash, but you're right to mention both and I like how you did your review of 20263. Done (thanks!)
